api/events-api.title: Events
api/events-api.description: The Events api can be accessed from finder.events.

api/filters-api.title: Filters
api/filters-api.description: The Filters api can be accessed from finder.filters.

api/group-by-api.title: GroupBy
api/group-by-api.description: The GroupBy api can be accessed from finder.groupBy.

api/index.title: API
api/index.description: Finder offers an imperative API that can access local state and mutate rules.

api/matches-api.title: Matches
api/matches-api.description: The Matches api can be accessed from finder.matches.

api/pagination-api.title: Pagination
api/pagination-api.description: The Pagination api can be accessed from finder.pagination.

api/search-api.title: Search
api/search-api.description: The Search api can be accessed from finder.search.

api/sort-by-api.title: SortBy
api/sort-by-api.description: The Sortby api can be accessed from finder.sortBy.

api/test-api.title: Tests
api/test-api.description: Test lets you test a ruleset's results without mutating state. The Tests api can be accessed from finder.test.

components/finder.title: Finder
components/finder.description: The root component, Finder accepts an armada of configuration properties and provides simplified context to consuming components.

components/finder-content.title: Finder.Content
components/finder-content.description: FinderContent accepts a set of renderProps, and will determine the most appropriate state to display. Only a single state can be active at a time.

components/finder-search-term.title: Finder.SearchTerm
components/finder-search-term.description: This handy component allows you to highlight the segments in your haystack that matched your searchTerm.

index.title: Finder
index.description: Use static rules to effortlessly sort, filter, search, and group data.

rules/effects/index.title: Effects
rules/effects/index.description: Effects let you trigger callbacks when certain Finder conditions change. While you could also use an onChange event to recreate the same functionality, effects can be invaluable tools for complex forms with connected rules.

rules/effects/rule-effects.title: Rule Effects
rules/effects/rule-effects.description: ruleEffects are onChange callbacks triggered when certain rules are changed. It allows you to couple rules to each other wihout adding complex onChange events.

rules/effects/search-effects.title: Search Effects
rules/effects/search-effects.description: searchEffects are triggered when the user searches for certain terms. You may want to suggest a filter, or preload data based on their search terms.

rules/filter-rule.title: FilterRule
rules/filter-rule.description: Define a filter predicate that will return a boolean for each item. If multiple filters are active, all filters must match for an item to be returned.

rules/index.title: Rules
rules/index.description: "Rules" are static definitions that tell Finder how to interact with the unique shape of your Items objects. Finder will use that information to determine what internal state to track.

rules/ruleset.title: FinderRuleset
rules/ruleset.description: Optional wrapper to ensures that an array of rules all have the correct shape.

rules/search-rule.title: SearchRule
rules/search-rule.description: Select strings from your items to search against

rules/sort-by-rule.title: SortByRule
rules/sort-by-rule.description: Only a single sortBy rule can be active at one time.

tutorial/component.title: Display Results
tutorial/component.description: Now that we have our ruleset, time to pass it to a Finder instance!

tutorial/controls.title: Build Controls
tutorial/controls.description: Finder doesn't have any opinion on how controls are rendered. Rule definitions, and state accessors/mutators are exposed so you can roll your own controls.

tutorial/ruleset/search.title: Search
tutorial/ruleset/search.description: Let's start with the simplest Rule: a search.

tutorial/ruleset/sort-by.title: Sort By
tutorial/ruleset/sort-by.description: We want to offer a couple of sort options to the user.
